intro: Amoora myrmecophila, commonly known as the blackwood tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and is often found in lowland and hill forest habitats. Amoora myrmecophila has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It plays an important ecological role, particularly in supporting ant species that inhabit its hollow stems.
